page.title: 08Whittlesford Society
page.content: The Whittlesford Society was set up ten years ago,in October 1975 to stimulate public interest in the village,promote high standards of planning and architecture and secure the protection and improvement of features of public or historical interest. The Society,which has over 300 members,organizes a number of annual events.These include a popular garden party in July,a village clean-up,a village walk,talks and excursions.In October 1983 it mounted a major historical exhibition covering various aspects of village life,and in April 1985 it ran a successful artistic exhibition entitled "Impressions of Whittlesford" The society produces a quarterly magazine "Whither Whittlesford" providing a record of village life.
